article_title: Just One-Third Of Hospitals IT-Ready For Population Health

article_metadata.author: Bruce Japsen

og.description: As the U.S. health system shifts away from fee-for-service medicine to value-based care, just one-third of hospitals say they have the necessary information technology systems in place to manage populations of patients. A new survey unveiled at the annual Healthcare Information and Management Systems Society (HIMSS) conference says about one-third, or [...]
